reviews.text: Lombardy is a lovely old hotel, beautifully kept and exceptionally clean.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay here, we could walk to everything, several nice restaurants nearby.
reviews.title: Short stay in Washington hotel Lombardy

reviews.text: We couldn't fault this hotel at all, loved the old worlds feel and beautiful
reviews.title: total disappointment and manager lacks compassion

reviews.text: furniture in the room.
reviews.title: Great rooms in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed for two nights whilst I was transitting from Washington to Atlanta and fully agree with the recent comments about its location. It's a short walk i.e. less than 10mins from Foggy-Bottom and no problems finding it. The hotel was small by US standards, the rooms was very comfortable. We found all the staff were friendly and the food was very good, we had dinner and breakfast both very enjoyable, good quality and reasonably priced. I would recommend a room on the upper floors due to the aircon units outside of the building. I would recommend eating at The Elephant & Castle great atmosphere and the Founding Farmers for the best eggs benedicts! I would look this hotel up again if I'm in the area.
reviews.title: Good value

reviews.text: Recently stayed a weekend at The Hotel Lombardy while moving our daughter into college. We ended up staying there bc many other hotels were booked. What luck we had- this hotel was great! The rooms are so spacious and the bed sheets are crisp as can be!! There was a nice kitchen area with a table and chairs which was great. Staff was very helpful and location was perfect for getting around. Just made reservations for Parents Weekend too!!
reviews.title: Best little secret!

reviews.text: I recently stayed as part of a two-day business trip where I attended a conference at the GWU Marvin Center.
reviews.title: Charming old world hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location for getting to GWU is excellent, and it is also close to the Foggy Bottom Metro stop and to the Foggy Bottom Whole Foods.
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself is more like an old-school European experience. Tiny lobby, slow elevators, older hotel, smaller spaces, but done very nicely. For example, my room (regular King-size bed) came with a small kitchen and small dressing area. The bathroom is indeed very small, and I would have traded my dressing area for a bit more elbow-room in the bath.
reviews.title: Charming, clean, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My room was near the front of the hotel, and I had no problem with street noise.
reviews.title: We love this hotel

reviews.text: I was in Washington DC for an event at the State Department. The Lombardy hotel was nearby, I was very pleased with my stay. The receptionist was particularly helpful when I needed help changing my train reservation. The room -- and especially the bed -- were super comfortable. A friend and I enjoyed a quiet conversation in the cocktail lounge. I would love to return one day!
reviews.title: Convenient location, charming ambiance.
Sensible "Boutique" Hotel; No Flare!
reviews.text: All in all, it served it's and our purpose for a couple of days. We took a r a quick city trip from New York by train for the MLK 50th March on Washington. I liked the "boutiqueness" of the hotel (converted small one-bedroom apartments); staff was okay -- basically stayed their distance but responded well to requests; liked that the windows opened and the supposed "kitchette" -- which it is not -- but served us well as a small bar. I did not like (a) the view -- an empty building construction site adjacent to the hotel -- not good. The bed was okay but would agree with a previous reviewer that it was a little "hard for my taste". The location was okay but we took taxis everywhere. Went down to the bar and did not get a good reception. The bartender said they were closing although it was several people still sitting at the bar drinking at 10:30 pm (I think he was just ready to go home). Ate out all the time so can't comment on the restaurant, although I never smelled it tempting aromas coming out of it. Tip: For great food and atmosphere, try Georgia Brown's -- a 8-10 minute taxi ride down the street. Reservations necessary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An old building, with all of the beauty and charm...our every need was met from check-in to departure We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September 2013. The staff was very nice, polite and helpful. We came to Washington for our anniversary and they upgraded our room from one King bed to suite without any charge. . Room was quaint with a king size and lovely old world furniture Also,the rooms was lovely, clean, and comfortable. Also, hotel just a few blocks from the Metro station at Foggy Bottom and within easy walking distance of all Washingtons main attractions and only five blocks from the White House. . Highly recommend the Hotel Lombardy
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.text: Thanks a lot for wonderful time at Hotel Lombardy.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights in September 2013. The staff were very nice, polite and helpful. They upgraded our room from one King bed to two doubles without any charge.
reviews.title: Good if you like old world charm, otherwise...
Lots of charm in a priceless location
reviews.text: Charming hotel in a location very convenient to the attractions of Washington DC. This is a smaller hotel with comfortable clean updated rooms, a very attentive and accommodating staff and a decent workout room. Easy walk to the metro stations, lots of places nearby to eat, walking distance to many of the monuments of our nations capitol. I have stayed here several times and have not been disappointed.

There were a total of seven rooms for us this trip as I had my customer, academic partner and and my own staff stay here. I love this hotel and everyone was thrilled to have stayed here…great staff (cannot say enough about the staff from the bellman to front desk to the restaurant and cleaning crew), great location, impeccable rooms and great value. The staff bent over backwards to help me with our meeting at dinner Sunday and lunch in the Venetian Room yesterday.
reviews.title: This is the best Hotel for business or pleasure when in Wash DC!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant is so good that it makes no sense to go anywhere else and there are many choices in the immediate area. The historic hotel is quaint, not modern - well equipped and safe as I have traveled here alone in the past.
reviews.title: Great hotel, nice rooms & very central to main sites, terrible shower pressure

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My guests were impressed and all said this will be their home in Wash DC next visit.
reviews.title: A great way to see the capitol

reviews.text: As I have in the past, I will make this my spot to stay when I am in Wash DC.
reviews.title: Charming hotel, good location
